values: safe transition back from this to this. final notes will be there.

P.S. I forgot to mention that yesterday we went to Berkeley to get Indian Food, and when we came back one of our suite mates was sitting outside our door with MY HARRY POTTER BOOK. When we walked up she pointed at me and was like 'Oh! Oh! I borrowed this because my room mate is leaving early and had to go to sleep and I'm really sorry I was sitting out here so you didn't think I stole it and just let me know when you need it back!' I was like 'uh... okay...' because I obviously wasn't reading it, but seriously.

Coming into our room and taking a book?! That is so fucking creepy!

Then my face wash and my moisturizer was mysteriously missing, but nothing else was, which is you know, weird. At least I was running out of both so I'd have to buy more anyway, and Jaime let me use her stuff for the night. It's not big enough a deal for me to confront them, but it is a big enough deal for me to be weirded out and lock our bathroom door when we leave.

At least she [the suite mate] volunteered to clean our bathroom for us. Dear God.

For anyone meeting me at the airport WITHOUT CHRIS I assume that most people are going with Chris ('cause not a lot of people are going obviously, airports are nasty) but if for some reason you're not (I don't really know if anyone else is driving there) MAKE SURE YOU TEXT ME SOMETIME ON THE DAY ON SATURDAY, PREFERABLY BEFORE 2 YOUR TIME. I'm going to be flying from SFO -> Denver -> Milwaukee, and if you plan on meeting me there you won't be able to get to the gate because security now requires a boarding pass to get up there. My phone will be off most of the day since I'm flying with only an hour and a half layover in Denver, but if you want to meet me at the airport you need to make sure I know to let you know my flight number once I figure out what it will be from Denver to Milwaukee. Then you can check those giant board things and look up my flight number and go to the gate of that concourse, which is where I'll be coming out before I get my bags and all that jazz. If you can't get a hold of me and are dead set on coming, make sure you get a hold of Chris. YOU ARE SO NOT OBLIGATED TO GO and this isn't meant to like make you think you should go, it's just because in about 10 minutes I'm putting my computer away and will become much much much more difficult to get a hold of. If you DO need me, for whatever, you could try calling but it'll be much easier for me to reply by text because it's closing day, closing ceremonies, tearful goodbyes, etc. Also lots of cleaning. So anyway that's that, I'll see you all in 15.5 hours!

Last night when I was straight chillin and talking to Nate, he was like 'listen to my friend's music!' and I was like 'er... okay.' Because you know, that's kind of awkward; you can do it, but then what if you don't like it, and it's his friend, and blah blah blah? Okay well good news I liked it and his music is super catchy and I can't stop listening to it, you all should go check it out. The Umbrella cover, if nothing else. Just ask Jess, who I recruited to listen to it last night. It's cute. http://myspace.com/listentonickmiller.

I'm mostly packed, our room is mostly cleaned.

Left to pack:
the clothes I'm wearing, and the ones for the next two days as I finish with them
cosmetics that I need daily (this includes TOWELS)
extra foods (bars etc)
chargers etc for my cellphone
laptop
nalgene bottle, silverware

Left to clean:
sweeping
sink clean out
minor bathroom clean out (nothing too bad)
dusting drawers and what not

With these suitcases in the room on the floor and full, it just feels so definite. I feel ready to go home, and at the same time very not - it's hard to see people every day for 28 days and then just not anymore. we'll stay in touch, but going home is just going to be different. i'm starting to get more and more anxious about leaving. this whole middle ground where we're here but not here (especially tomorrow night when we're nearly entirely packed, with everything all put up and what) and we've kind of demolished our home for the past four weeks is going to feel really gross. I'm excited to see everyone, though, don't worry.

Wow, tonight we have a mandatory check out meeting, tomorrow we hang art and pack... friday night is the show, then we check out, and the next day mi madre is driving me and jaime to the airport. Wow.

It feels really weird, I can't really explain it; it's like a) we just got here b) we've been here forever (we're just that close to people, and everything is so routine) and all at once c) we're never going to leave. The latter isn't really in a bad way, it just seems like it should go on being like THIS - like these classes, teachers, and peers, coming home every day at 4 to Todd and Jaime and some crazy music in our dorms. Now that leaving is becoming more of a reality I guess it's a little better to comprehend 'home' but it still feels like we should be coming back here afterwards, like when school starts up, i should be back in Oakland with all of these same people doing all of this same stuff and living in this same room. It's weird, but it's easy to think of our dorm as home, and it's easy to think of this area as 'our place' and the 'places we go.' I know the city so well, it's going to be weird going back to milwaukee.

i think i might be more nervous to go home and start integrating back into the normal flow of things than i was to come out here, which is strange. i don't know, it just feels like i missed a lot, and maybe most of it is just excitement to see everyone. if my flight is delayed i might have to smack a bitch. I don't really want to spend time on traveling, i just want to fall asleep on the plane and then wake up and we're home. Layover in Denver is going to suck, but it's only like an hour once you take out time for boarding and stuff, so I guess I'll just read me some Harry Potter and recharge the iPod.

plane comes in at 6.50pm (knock on wood) and after i go home for a little bit i'm definitely going to want to do something. keep in mind, my time 6.50 is like 4.50 so i'll be wide awake.

see you guys soon.

<lj-cut text="Bitch information here.">
Okay so it was MOS DEF Plan B, Jaime and I are so good at deducing these things. To find this out required a failed trip to Safeway/Longs with her lover/boyfriend and Todd and her barging into our room and being obnoxious several more times. But to be fair, her lover/boyfriend is actually fairly hilarious and nice, and Todd is of course Todd.

Anyway so I just thought I'd share that with you guys. =)
</lj-cut>

So not to much going on in the casa... we've just been straight chillin. Last night Todd was in here until after Jaime and I passed out because he was working on his final project for Industrial Design, making a lamp and flowers and stuff. All of my projects are DONE and Jaime is in jewelery so I guess a lot of her projects have to be worked on in the actual jewelery room.

Tonight or tomorrow we're going to Berkeley to get Indian food and celebrate our survival of this course.

Two days to go, not counting today; which for me is just crits in the morning and a field trip in the afternoon. I don't know where the time went! The closer we get to leaving time the more time I have to think about everyone back home and how much I miss you guys. My flight gets back at like 6.50pm on Saturday, so we'll make it a point to hang out ASAP. (Pray for no flight delays, okay?!)

So this dumb whore on our floor clearly wants to throwdown, she has demonstrated this by embodying my number one pet peeves: chicks who want to be friends with all the guys, yet ignore their female friends in the process and are complete bitches. (I suppose this pet peeve really extends to ALL of the guy's friends, I just happen to be a girl so, well, you know. Also this issue probably affects me more because a lot of my friends are guys. So there.) Okay so this whore is all buddy buddy yay todd to todd, and yet she hates me and jaime. Me and jaime walk up and she's like 'oh.' Literally. Oh. We've tried waving at her and she just kind of purses her lips/scowls and walks on. Except the other day I kind of got her to wave, but she could've very easily just been swatting at flies because she was coughing and looked very displeased. She hates me and Jaime. Anyway so yesterday at like 1 in the morning this chick barges into the room (todd was passed out on jaime's bed - I was laying on my bed on the computer, and jaime was at her desk) looking for todd, wakes him up out of a dead sleep while causing a huge commotion, and while her friend/boyfriend/lover (I don't know which) Grant is being cheerful and friendly and she's kind of sort of explaining why she's there she fuggin goes through my desk. Goes. through. my desk. She like lifted up my art project and looked at the book under it which first of all, is really invasive because it's an art project, and second of all, bitch I don't want you looking at my books. Then she starts like looking through all of my sketchbooks/italian/book books on the top shelf. What the fucking hell! Finally she's like 'Oh Todd I need you to buy me something can you come out in the hall so we can talk about it?' except she makes a big deal about it (keep in mind - Todd = 19). And then makes Todd promise not to tell us. And then comes back in 10 minutes later with some money for Todd to buy whatever, RIGHT IN FRONT OF US all like 'thanks todd, thanks for buying IT for me! thanks! yeah i really need it! thanks!' WHAT A BITCH, WHO DOES THAT RIGHT IN FRONT OF OTHER PEOPLE?! The least you can do is be like 'Oh sorry I just need to talk to Todd for a second.' and do it in a more tactful way, dumb bitch. Okay so we've narrowed it down to: cigarettes (doubtful - Jaime thought she saw one or two 20's), salvia (doubtful - Todd doesn't even know what that is), plan b (most likely - it costs right around $40, and you have to be 18, and it explains why she AND grant came in to ask about it). GDMT LOOK A PORTKEY!

Today was the most excellent of chill days, as all Sundays tend to be here - Jaime and I have made it a strong tradition to do nothing on Sundays, including simple things like getting dressed, which makes room for much better things that can be done, such as reading all of harry potter and then finishing off a half a jar of salsa with our wonderful friend todd. I'm definitely going to go back and read HP7 more slowly to absorb all the details, but from my 8 hour reading marathon that was outstandingly amazing and I loved all of it. The cuts are picture heavy, so be warned. Later I'll get the picture of Jaime and I discovering a Portkey up. Jaime and I being cool in front of a 'Where the Wild Things Are' mural. Why yes, there probably is a Harry Potter book in that bag. In my spare time I like to, you know, make fun of tanks. And stuff. Unfortunate line through Todd's face. Note Jaime's crunk cup. I think we were going for sexy face. LOL.

DEAR GOD I just finished reading Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows.

OUTSTANDING.

after getting my HARRY FUCKING POTTER book we traversed to 24th and Mission St, heart of the mission district, and I would like to point out how outstanding it is; as soon as we got out of the Bart station there was loud mexican music playing and there are murals just EVERYWHERE. I loved it, it was so bright and colorful and happy - we explored and went to Balmy Alley (pictures below) because one of the artists who helped organize its creation years ago came and talked to my community arts class. Then we called Jaime's sister for a restaurant suggestion and ate at this fabulous place with amazing tofu fajitas. It was sooo much food. Then we treked through the gayborhood (the Castro District) to get to the Haight/Ashbury neighborhood, which is hippieville and thrifty stores. Pictures will come of our adventures into a photobooth. On the way back there was this tranny dancing on the steps leading up to Buena Vista Park (which is just stairs and forest - you can't see much else, it's on a big hill) and his hips did not lie. Neither did his skirt, which flashed us a bit of ass from across the street and down a few flights. He was clearly beckoning Todd into the forest but we didn't get a picture. Bummer. Then icecream and now home, there is a drag ball going on but I'm tired and Todd won't let us dress him like a girl. Pitty. (For Lauren. Shortly after taking it I think a latino man might have professed his love for me/his love for my love of art but i don't speak espanol. no habla!) Right next to this one, I didn't get a good picture, was a stencil of a stiletto and it said 'GIRLS WHO WEAR FIVE INCH HEALS SHOULDN'T HAVE TO PAY FOR THEIR MEALS.' Also all around town were little stencils that said things like 'As the moon rose over Pontromero Hill, she said, "Fuck off, nothing is as it seems!"' Fabulous. WARNING: PICTURE HEAVY.

Last night there was a 4.2 earthquake centered in Oakland, Jaime assures me it was muy fun on the top bunk.

I slept through it, lol lol, but apparently it was a pretty good sized one.

last night jaime went to homework night after me and her and todd chilled out in the casa (i finished reading haunted). todd and i, alone to fend for ourselves, went back to his room to chill and Jon the swede came by with his PSP and the guys started playing some video game where the first boss was apparently really hard, and they were both trying for a long time to beat her and they kept dying and jon gave me the thing and i beat her in two tries.

i guess i get it from having you fuckers as my friends. =) they later got lost in some area and didn't know where to go and I found it for them. Silly boys.

Anyway when Jaime came back we came over to our room with Todd's computer and nice ass speakers (which are still in our room) and watched Interstella 5555, that daft punk music video for a WHOOLLLEE album. It was fabulous.

I learned how to make tofu after that. Oh, and Jaime and I got yelled at for checking our mail after hours, shut up front desk bitch. Ner, what else... nothing else. I had a dream that Todd and I taught Schmitty how to read while Jaime was at her class dinner thing.

P.S. my teacher is getting married on friday and anabelle, this girl in my class, was like 'oh so is it like a church wedding, or a city hall thing, or what?' and he was like, totally straight faced, 'it's a satanic theme.' wait for it. 'it's just a wedding, what the fuck girl?!'

except we all thought he was serious lol lol.

TODAY TODAY TODAY was a GLORIOUS DAY because 1) WE LOOKED AT BANKSY IN A CLASS. FABBITY. and 2) we're drawing portraits, and thanks to C*Willey I am just owning.

Lollapalooza has been sorted. Get in or get out. Dolce & Gabbana can't come to my party because they use ampersands - however, Prada is cordgially invited.

After school we chilled out and then went to Todd's room, where Jaime and I took an hour long nap on his immensly comfortable bed. What are friends for, if not to take over their beds while they download copious amounts of music?

1/2 of my Midterm - DONE!

Also, today Jaime saw Schmitty smoking in the designated smoker's area (yeah, we have that, fuck you) and as he was going to take a drag he dropped his cigarette on the ground and did this little 'oh god i dropped my cigarette on the ground' dance. Outstanding. OUTSTANDING.

today was fabbity because i got to do extremely well in class - we're doing portrait drawing, like little 10-12 minute things of a partner and I ROCK because I had c*willey as a teacher. then we're just working on a project all day in the second half of my day which is also fabbity because i am just totally owning it. class aside, i ate baked tofu from the cafe and fake kind of nasty but kind of addicting guacamole from safeway. i also got salsa. and then we cooked at the apartments for todd and chilled out in his room with none other than John, our swedish friend who lives in argentina, and who has this strange knack for appearing whenever we start talking about him. must be a swede thing, i swear. anyway jaime and i drew little diagrams of our houses and gave each other tours so that was fun. NOW IT IS TIME FOR SLEEPIES IN MY NEW MIAD SHIRT THAT MOMMY SENT ME. (anyone thinking of sending anything - this is the last week to do it so that it gets here in time for the eating) so i have this cafe card that i don't really need (oops) but i need to use it up so i'm not wasteful, and jaime and todd have some too so we're eating at the cafe for lunch for the rest of forever. anyway that's not the point, on the way back jaime and i spotted schmitty walking back from lunch with his whole 2 liter bottle of fresca under one arm. Oh also a friend who we will call "Thing 2." we were going in to get our water bottles/wash our hands after lunch and we were just going to take the stairs, but behold, the elevator doors open - we piled in, little did we know, right after Schmitty and Thing 2. Who smelled like rancid taco dip that is slowly being secreted from the pores with a foul mix of BO and horrible expired Axe. God. anyway so schmitty is being all awkward because that's how he is all the time, and he kind of knows us just because we're always in his room so he's like 'uh. hi.' and jaime is trying to be nice so she says 'what's up schmitty?' and he gets all crazy like 'what? uh. oh. nothing.' and his friend laughed at him for his 2L or something I don't know so we get off the elevator blah blah blah do our shit I end up leaving before Jaime but I have to go back because I forgot my god damn purse - shit fuck, so I run back to get it after she kindly unlocks the door and then I get back into the elevator with NONE OTHER THAN SCHMITTY AND THING 2. AWKWARD ASS ELEVATOR RIDE. We're just sitting there and so I decide to break the silence by asking him about the current Industrial Design project (Todd, Alex, John, Paige - they're all in ID). Schmitty's reply to how it's going: 'oh. uh. i don't know. it's okay. yeah. okay.' and Thing 2 says: 'no dude. it's uh, it's better than okay. it's like, it's like great. yeah. you're just being uh.... what's the word... uh... you know... the word... yeah... what's the word... uh...' This takes a few floors down in the world's slowest elevator and finally I interject, 'Modest?' 'No, not modest... uh... that word... like... when you don't give yourself enough credit... uh... HUMBLE.' Dear God.

pajama days of eating lots of things and stealing 1300 songs from todd's 10000 song library are rad.

also, smell mapping todd's dorm:
garlicy broccoli -> pez/taco bell -> barbecue masking tape -> bad hair spray with a slight undercurrent of sickly sweet and skunk.

this is why we love our room.

most painful experience of my life:

todd was talking about how schmitty has all this chicken in the freezer and he was like "he better give me some. no, really. if i'm like 'can i have some?' and he's like 'no' then i'm just going to have to lay it out and throw down be like 'oh, really? because your left boob just said yes.'"

i laughed so hard my mascara started running and all i could see was murky blackness and pain and then jaime fell asleep in todd's bed and we just stumbled back to our room.

ow.

so, today was good, but pretty slow. the whole waking up at noon thing is magical but it kind of throws the rest of the day out of focus. it was okay though; we put our pretty new dresses on and walked our happy asses into the oakland/piedmont area of town and saw HARRY FUCKING POTTER BITCHES. it was good and entertaining but they left some stuff out and that was sad making. anyway, then we came home. todd is becoming an organ snatcher. bitch, he's todd bigelow! okay okay okay so what next. oh laundry day. we did two loads of laundry and crammed in all of the dirty clothes jaime, todd, and i had accumulated in the past two weeks. and learned how to fall asleep standing up in the laundry room. the clothes were so warm and delicious (we stole some of schmitty's detergent - it actually smells like sunshine daisies) that jaime and i changed into pajama type things and now we're just straight chillin while todd listens to music with the swede somewhere over in his room. i should take more pictures for this thing but i'm too lazy, so i'll just eat fugnugs and drink my tea. oh wait i think i might have some pictures hold on. This was a few nights ago... we stood at the end of the hall and stared at the apartments with my big huge camera to try and get Alex's attention. FYI there is no "good" bunk - if you're up top you have to climb up but bonus you don't have to get up to answer doors and shit, that is the bottom bunk's job, but if you're on the bottom bunk, fuckers like todd always take your place. to be fair, it is closest to the little wall we designated as his spot, when he finally decides to just move a mattress in.

last night, somewhere between 1 and 2 am, as we were all settling down to listen to music/finish lost in translation i mos def passed out in this very strange position kind of diagonally curled up on my bed with my bed against the wall/a towel because todd had taken my spot (jaime was sitting up on her bed watching the movie). anyway so i fell asleep like that until about 5 in the morning when i woke up and went back to a normal sleeping position and fell back asleep until about half an hour ago (11.30).

I love sleeping late.

WE HAVE VEGETARIAN FUGNUGS. =)

and it's a lazy friday. tomorrow is harry potter. god, it's so good.

happy birthday to todd, happy birthday at mona lisa's, happy birthday from coit tower, happy birthday from the bay, happy birthday from that hill we climbed, happy birthday from little italy, happy birthday to todd.

todd's current possessions in our room (while he is not present):
the condoms
the name tag
his nice ass speakers
a box which contains:
a pair of very holey jeans
a birthdaycard
a giant marshmallow/chocie chip brownie

dude.

also happy birthday to him, congrats on 19.

for alex's birthday we baked delicious cupcakes. we filled them with ice cream and frosted them and they were delicious, so we were told, and then after some lots of chill time while we looked for a rave to go to on our last day here (and worked on making alex a fake ID, since I can use Jaime's sister's), we went on a long walk to the top of this giant hill.

and talked about houses.

and walked back down, in about 5 minutes before curfew, it was kind of perfection.

tomorrow is field trip day, san francisco campus baby.

new favorite poet - lisa radon. author of 'super deluxe with everything' and one of the authors in concrete dreams.

"i'm waiting to get off the train
an old black man looks up at me
'go forth and do great things'
and wow, i feel touched by god.

and the guy selling pot out of his dirty sneaker..."

if you're bored and looking for something to do the only real answer is to google search 'cupcakes' and go through the whole list, which is what jaime did today to procrastinate doing her homework. todd and i applauded her since he more or less lives in our room now, esp. after schmitty found out we've been pranking him and R.A. JP totally sided with us. It's updated because Jaime drew a picture of me and her and Todd as cupcakes, and Alex is a pair of pants with a $700 price tag chillin at the bottom. Also a cupcake anatomy which includes the liner, cup, gooey center, pudge, frosting, mama's love, etc etc. in other news, i miss you all and time change sucks; it's like 2.30 in Wisco and it's only 12.30 here. Bummer. Oh also today Nate made me as a Sim. So that's exciting. And... yeah. I miss ya'll, send us some fabulous prizes - I sent out a few letters circa July 4th and they got there today, whoo whoo. (NOTE: they were only to like 3 people because I just don't have time to color so don't feel bad if you didn't get one, they're coming in spurts and groups.)

Jaime is my room mate.

Todd lives down the hall in 312 with

Schmitty Cent who we are terrible to because he looks like a pubescent lesbian and watches anime in the lounge until 3am, not to mention he put signs in the bathroom, something that we don't even do, and there was dog shit in our bathroom.

Alex lives across the street in the apartments and we are very mean to each other (in a friendly way).

Max lives with Alex and 4 other guys.

Katie lives on the 2nd floor with Jen.
</lj-cut>

yesterday todd overslept so we'll have to see about schmitty's whole ordeal today. =( whatever.

yesterday, yesterday, yesterday...

yesterday i slept until about 12 and didn't get dressed. at all. all day. jaime was doing homework and i was reading/looking up cupcakes/talking to nate and then around 5 todd came over from his room where he'd been working on shoe drawings for his class. eventually we went over to the apartments to snag a free salad and watched some youtube videos with alex and a bunch of his roommates, including his roommate max, who as alex put it is "goofy" and very unintentionally hilarious.

then we came back and it was going to be movie night except it wasn't movie night and then i went to sleep at like 1.

I am les tired!

i was really tired last night so i think i just kind of gave a broad overview of the hilarious things that happened when i really wanted to go into detail on just a few, such as the fact that you would all be amazed at what can be done in a tiny bathroom sink - such as dishes, which we ended up dumping/scraping off into the toilet so that we didn't clog our drain.

"there comes a time in our life when we have to go buy draino."

also - todd has not banged on our door nor have we heard schmitty yelling, so I'm a little worried. I'm going to eat some carrots.

p.s. slept in until 12 and it feels wonderful.

operation schmity condom is currently underway - if i were you, i would be amazed at our incredible genius. before he went to bed i was lounging on todd's bed and jaime was fussing over cupcakes but we kept making comments with sexual undertones, and then as soon as he started snoring we filled up one of alex's condoms with some lotion and water and laid it by his arm. we rattled the bed a little and made a quick escape, and jaime got some fabbity pictures so that's good, hopefully todd will put them up because it's hilarious. anyway, today we went to san fran after chilling at the apartments and eating alex's banana bread while we watched maximus juggle. amazing. we had a nice little walk - got off at the embarcadero, wandered around, went to chinatown, went to citylights (bought ANOTHER book), went to japantown which was kind of a hike, bought nori and hello kitty starbursts, had a japanese mall adventure... I took this picture for Lauren. =) Alex and Todd straight chillin on the BART. They were being mirrors and so were me and jaime, but you can't see us obviously. Todd also decided to climb the apartment building while we waited for Alex to come let us in. Then we came back and jaime made sushi while todd and i rearranged his room, although schmitty walked in halfway through and we wanted it to be a surprise. Aww, shucks. So alex came over right as the sushi was getting ready and he helped make a few of the last rolls and then we ate and it was magical Chill time chill time chill time operation schmitty time and now actually it is bed time.

yes, we can has slumber parties.

it started out with all of us straight chillin in todd's room doing horrible things to his roommate, schmitty. (they switched all of us sour cream n' onion chips with his honey bunches of oats, and then todd was going to toss one of the free condoms from the front desk down at him in the middle of the night with some lotion in it - to top that one off, jaime and I were going to come in early and then make a big show about leaving and stuff. lol lol.)

okay so anyway, alex was trying to stay but he had to leave to go back to the apartments and then these two other girls came (one from california, one from oregon) so we were talking for awhile, but halfway through, jaime and i got really tired. so we decided to sleep on todd's bed. anyway we woke up about when the girls left and when todd took pictures of us sleeping at strange strange angles and then we made him come sit on the very comfortable bed and we decided to has a slumber partyz.

except about that time schmitty walked in and gave us the most strange look and just turned around and walked out. he was like 'don't worry i'm going' and we were like 'you don't have to go!' and then i guess when we left to move the slumber party to our room (and my bed, because bottom beds work better for these things) he told todd not to have sex in his bed and then shuffled off to the lounge to watch anime. so anyway we came over here and ate a great many things, such as green tea, spinach, strawberry cheesecake ice cream, golden sundae icecream, and also tortillas. Actually jaime ate the tortillas. With icecream in them.

THEN WE HAS A SLUMBER PARTYZ LOL. It was really just all of us sleeping on my bed in little balls except Jaime was smart and switched to her bed at about 4 or so. Fucking genius.

p.s. jaime and i accidently stole food from the homeless. =(

last night was probably one of the most fun nights of my whole life. It was a designated 'homework night' so there were no official events planned so that we could catch up on homework. And sleep, of course, since we are all so short on that - but our plan to go to bed really early was FOILED!

Jaime and I stayed in and all the guys went out to cheap mexican food and we decided that we're going to have 'No dinner dinners' where we pack like little tupperwares of food and go out to eat with them so we don't have to spend money. then we can be shystie and eat under the table. Anyway so Todd came by when they all got back because he lives on our floor and he didn't feel like going out with the rest of them and he ended up chilling with us until like 2 - we just kind of sat around and talked, and then at one point we to our floor's 'VERY MERRY UNBIRTHDAY PARTY.'

This is where it starts getting fun because aside from eating cake and icecream we MOS DEF stole about 8 cupcakes and 2 sandwiches to put in our freezer for later use - HILARIOUS. Jaime and I took some and then went to Todd's dorm and got some of his clothes and put our hair up and wore those to steal some more. Then we were like laughing at how sneaky we were and taking pictures of our stolen food and making facebook groups when we got a little bored (oh we also played with my tablet and so Jaime has decided to draw me a picture every day. See Facebook.) when we got the genius idea to grab my camera and go lay by the window that faces out at the apartments (it's floor to ceiling) and cryptically call Alex.

Jaime mos def called him and just growled and made these weird clicking noises and he was like having a heart attack. "Are you crackheads? Are you crackheads who stole Todd's phone? What the fuck, man?" Hilarity ensued.

Dear LORD.
much thanks to nate who just drunk dialed me, i think it was probably one of the most hilarious things since the astroturf car of yesterday, no joke.

i don't think i will ever feel well rested being here - i sleep fine, our beds aren't that uncomfortable and the temperature is pretty dec when we actually have to sleep, it's just that we're always doing something. Like homework, or social activity, or class...

today in drawing we had to do at least 50 ten second gesture drawings and a bunch of 30 second ones.

in other news, i'm seriously beginning to miss the guys that shower as infrequently as I do and spend less money on clothes than me. these guys are great, but i miss mine. =(

san francisco was replaced by berkley marina with jaime and alex and todd and some of the other guys, including their friend max who is fucking hilarious. just like... random stoner-esque comments, kind of like marc. aww.

there was this bossy black lady behind us who yelled some interesting comments as the fireworks went on:

"YEAH POPPIN PUSSYS!"
"C'MON BERKELEY SHOW ON."
"THAT SHIT LOOK LIKE WHOOPIE GOLDBERG'S HAIR."

And so on.

P.S. Our bathroom mates are having a rave in the bathroom apparently because they locked us out.

chris called from six flags so that was lovely, thank you dahling.

we walked down to Berkeley today and chilled around there, I bought FOUND MAGAZINE #3 and a really super cute dress that I'll only be able to wear when we're in San Francisco. But whatever, right?

tried bubble tea, found a wonderful market where we will now be doing all the shopping, and ate the most delicious peach i have ever tasted in all of life.

The end.

no pictures, but the rest of the night was as such:

dinner at zachary's pizza with jen and katie and jaime, we had this enormous deep dish pizza... left overs are mos def in the freezer.

then we came back and jaime and i were straight chillin (after rushing the bathroom) when our open door saved us again. jen and katie were taking ice cream over to todd's dorm, because alex and all of those guys were there but they all had to leave like right away for check in at the apartments and then they couldn't come back. so we just chilled in there and listened to much music and planned out our July 27th. (Pos daft punk and then daft punk after party? Si? Or else DJ Tiesto)

just came back over this way to some shystiness, but whatev.

there was a dog running loose in our room earlier, some girl is like certified to have it or something... special needs or training or whatev...

that's not that shystie. WHATEV WHATEV NO CLASS TOMORROW BITCHES.

today in drawing class we had to do blind contour drawings, which kind of sucked, not going to lie. everyone sucks at contours to begin with, but on top of that i was exhausted from... well really everything but mostly going to bed late last night after walking in San Francisco, so I kept zoning out. Jaime was worse off because she had more homework due right away and was up until like 3 or 4, ouch. We all did a corner of the mural and then twisted it into the center. Our only guidelines were our "roots," and we were supposed to interpret that anyway we wanted to... mostly people did where they came from. Maddy did a street car from New Orleans, Auddie did a mexican wonderful thing, Grace did Boulder, Colorado. I didn't feel like drawing Milwaukee skyline or pizza shuttle or my house so I drew the rock with an ohm. We've never actually painted that before but I'm a Buddhist so the ohm had to go in there. It didn't turn out too bad. I even added the 'PARK' sign as a memorial since it's not actually there anymore, boo. =(

the wonderful people at cca gave us a shower curtain, but nothing to hang it with, so the fabbity fab girls next door hung it with tape (which was much better than what we would've found, hands down - we had to stick a paper to our wall with gum). basically when you shower you have to kind of duck under the curtain to get in.

lol lol.

This is what our room looks like from the door: The sign you see '2 Days and a Fortnight' is an ad for a fortmaking contest they had in our floor's lounge... we went to Chinatown instead. Our beds, my desk, Jaime's chair... we both have a fabbity desk and chair, but I feel weird taking pictures of someone else's stuff... especially someone else's clean stuff, I have my sketchbook and some towels on mine at the mo... and lots of cords and a fan... and my iPod... and pencils... and... I guess it's not that bad when I'm not working on a project. San Fran crew. I took the picture like two seconds after Todd took one of us, I'm lucky it didn't get more flash in it. Jaime made a nice face for this. ALL OF OUR FOOD. For ten people, a lot of meat and like two point five veg meals. $10 a person? Nice, since it included the snails... big brown pile on the left. I'm sure the dorm at least would be a lot more cozy if we actually lived here and could get some rugs or what, but it's fine as is... and the road we're off of is so cute, all little cafes and thrift stores and what. And it was really chill to run around town today - so much freedom! I'm lovin it.

jaime and i always straight chill in our room with the door open, so right when we got back from a safeway outting and were snacking on dinner this kid she knew came by and asked if we wanted to go to chinatown.

duh.

so me and her and katie and jen and alex and max and matt and jasper and cassidy and todd all went down to chinatown where we thought alex was just getting us ridiculously lost, but we found a place to have dinner and they ordered, of all things, snails. Everyone but me and Katie (the vegs) tried them... you had to like scoop them out with a toothpick and bite it off just before the egg sack so you didn't eat baby snails... then suck out the juices... I took a lot of pictures on my phone so I'll see if maybe I can get those up in the next few days. We had a lazy susan just piled with food and we ate almost all of it, then we went back to katie and jen's dorm (a floor down) with todd from our floor and ate icecream. I feel sick.

Oh also, all of us minus cassidy and jasper and matt snuck into a hotel so we could go up to the top floor and look at the San Francisco night.

To see my teachers art:
josequinto.com
forrealism.com

Classes are super nice, I have drawing in the morning and in the afternoon Community Arts, which is actually going to be a pretty tight class on arts and art activism. We develop a lot of community stuff and complex ideas, so I'm pretty pumped for that.

Other than that, classes are really fucking exhausting... we got up this morning and had a little mini greeting by the staff and then they took us to our classes. It was mostly just talk for me (Jaime is in jewelery and metal foundry, so she started working) but towards the end we got to start on this collaborative thing that we're continuing tomorrow.

Now I'm going to go with these two girls from downstairs and Jaime and Auddi next door to SAFEWAY BRB

the best thing about california is that the temperature is perfect - even though our room was stuffy and a little warm last night, with two fans and then window open it got cool so fast I woke up like 5 minutes before my alarm because I was chilly.

very nice.

anyway, we set our alarms too early so now we're just sitting and chilling until 8.15 when we get to go do MORE ORIENTATION. YEAH YEAH.

and then obviously classes which I guess will be good, I don't know. I really don't entirely understand what community arts is, even though i signed up for it, so let's hope i get lucky. nothing else doing, but these odwalla bars are delicious and I encourage you all to eat some because they are going to get me through the month.

I'll be home in 26 days. =)

Courtney Morgan

My address, send me stuff. Just not too much stuff because I share a mailbox with my room mate, Jaime, who is really really chill. We're going to go eat lots of exotic food and see Harry Potter, so nyeh.

School is good, I really like the campus and the area is cute. We haven't really done much tonight except play some weird name game and eat some pizza, but big thanks for Chris and Mom for helping me move into the room and get groceries (the 3 trips to Long's and Safeway were well worth it).

I'm really tired but we have to stay awake until 11 blah blah blah checck in in the lounge. WHATEV WHATEV.

You can add my school on my myspace. I'm too lazy to look at our door for the URL though. Sorry.

This is us on the car just above Monterey Bay in Santa Cruz. Monterey Bay without us. This is from a hill on UCSC's campus. We are not allowed to drive the car. Palace of Fine Arts in downtown Santa Cruz, Marina District. A Buddha in the Japansese Tea Garden, Golden Gate Park. Tea Garden. There were some koi too. FULL HOUSE. FUCK YEAH. Lombard Street. Muy twisty! One of the big hills in Cali. I think we were going down Russian hill... they were so ridiculous, and my legs are so sore now. I'm going to go finish drinking my wine and wash the dye out of my hair, you better enjoy those pictures 'cause that's all you're getting until... well probably until I take pictures of my room and my Hello kitty sheets tomorrow. Shut up shut up shut up.

yeah shut up i'm still too lazy for pictures.

we woke up late today and went on a city tour that was like 5 hours long, it hit all the major things that we missed and the major thing that we had seen already (chinatown) was last so we just kind of left when they got there. we saw the tea gardens, nob hill, the opening scene from full house (LOL), uh... lord knows what else. Oh, Sausolito (SALSAlito) was nice too. It's a slightly warmer beach town than San Francisco, full of little art galleries and cafes and whatever.

other than that north beach is prolly my most fav. we got off there at the tour and went to City Lights (a beat bookstore founded by one of the beat founders!) and I bought two books, Our Space and Howl. I love that bookstore, mostly because they had Banksy and Obey Giant books in the window. The alley between that and Vesuvio (the beat coffee shop of choice) was all murals and gorgeous.

then we went into chinatown and i got presents for people, and then we ate at a little resturant in north beach and came back to the hotel.

now i'm eating pumpkin pie fudge and chillin. gonna dye my hair soon and then go to bed, tomorrow i move into my dorm yeah yeah.

pictures from tomorrow will come some time later today, probably when i'm redying my hair, simply because we're short on time this morning and my camera is across the room. yeah, i'm too lazy to get up and get it, shut the fuck up you don't know how big handicapped rooms are.

yesterday we drove down to santa cruz and toured the campus for chris - nice ass campus. if i didn't despise math and science and... well, all those other classes that I don't really have to take, i would probably go there. driving was fun, the top was down the whole way. the only downside to this was that I got a little pink, but i put some aloe on it and it's already going tan.

after santa cruz we headed to CalState Monterey Bay (at Seaside) which is a GHOST TOWN. We didn't even get out to look at that campus, it was scary shit. All we saw were two people (probably ghosts), a bunch of abandoned military baracks, a vulture, and an ass ton of grows all sitting in one tree and staring at us.

needless to say, we quickly put the top up and left, back to santa cruz for dinner.

today is some city wide tour of san fran... then more chinatown. tomorrow is moving into my dorm!

also: chris is in the bathroom and I can't get in to get my makeup brushes. shit.

We went down to Fisherman's Wharf again today, we had some night time tour of Chinatown. While waiting we took an hour tour of the bay so we saw the city and also Alcatrez. Favorite thing? People who beg for money in amazing and humorous ways. Example: Sign that says 'WHY LIE? I NEED A BEER' with a sign near his feet saying 'NOW ACCEPTING VISA, MASTERCARD, DISCOVER....' or the guy who asked for 'money or a joint' when we walked by. Walking back there was mos def the smell of pot, which was totally hilarious. At least he got what he wanted. We shopped a little bit and mostly bummed around touristy area, learned about the city, whatev whatev. There was a pretty nice break team... breaking, obviously. So that was exciting. One of the guys came up and the leader or whatev was introducing him as 'Whateverhisname was... really likes the white girls!' and my mom and chris started cheering and pointing at me. Awesome. After Chinatown (walking through) the last tour of the day stopped on Treasure Island (no, it's real) and we got to take night pictures. Now we're hoommmee. They still haven't found my luggage. Wonderful. Tomorrow we're going to Santa Cruz, driving down the coast to get there (top will be down, of course). First round of postcards should be going out in the next day or so.

So last night: flight was cancelled and we got rebooked via Midwest today, straight to San Francisco, at 11am. Even so, here are some drawings of airport people and stuff when we thought we were waiting to go to our connection in Denver. Then today we got here around two... pm, of course, and we got our car and luggage and stuff. The highlight? This door thing on a shuttle to the car rentals, if you stood in it too long some automated voice yelled at you. 'YOU ARE DELAYING THE PROGRESS OF THE PASSENGERS OF THIS TRAIN. PLEASE STEP ASIDE.' Dear lord... is that a mustang?! A mustang CONVERTIBLE to be more precise. Post 4 hour plane ride. The hotel. It's pretty nice, we're in a handicapped room, so we have.. well, a lot of room, and a big bathroom with no bathtub but a shower. So there's a positive for you. This is all of the luggage. Mine is the green duffel, the magenta suitcase, the camo carryon, and I also HAD a floral suitcase (same size) but the airport lost it. Luckily it was only dishes and sheets, and if they don't find it there is a giant blue Ikea right across the street so I can get cheap stuff of lesser quality for about the same price as the crap I bought at goodwill. Minus hello kitty sheets, but what can you do. Fuck an airline. So after our little adventure at the airport and driving in rush hour traffic, we got to our hotel and checked in and got jamba juice and drove down to Fisherman's Wharf - via longest way possible, as we parked in the middle of Chinatown and hiked. It was okay though: I went to Chinatown Walgreens, and now all other Walgreens pale in comparison.

Our flight is delayed, fabbity fab. They're looking for an 11 o'clock departure to Denver... isn't that sweet?

Looking forward to it.

"Well, if I were stuck in an airport terminal, I would fucking build a house. 'Well, I was stuck, but now I live here.' I have severely improved my prediciment!'"
